intro: Agrostemma laetum, commonly known as the yellow sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
